description:
The verb is from the 16th century. Origin uncertain; related to purl, pirn, prill (OED; more at pern, preen).
The noun was derived from the verb in the 19th century.

entries.meaning: A ripple; a twist or curl.

verbs.description: pirl (third-person singular simple present pirls, present participle pirling, simple past and past participle pirled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To twist or wind, especially into a cord or braid etc.
(intransitive) To ripple or swirl, especially of water.
(transitive) To cause to revolve or spin.
